definition: to resist/to hold back/to stop/to ward off/to withstand
to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)
to resist/to obstruct/to hinder/to keep off/to block (a blow)/to get in the way of/cover/gear (e.g. in a car's transmission)

sentences.english: That is financial The chairman is away on can resist the into financial stand white dragon represent this name?
sentences.chinese: 董事长不在的上成金融能否抵挡得住白龙这名恶煞？

sentences.english: We are commanded in Scripture to resist him, staying strong in our faith.
sentences.chinese: 我们在圣经中被命令要抵挡他，在信上坚强。

sentences.english: Some bread will keep off hunger for a while.
sentences.chinese: 吃些面包会抵挡一会儿饥饿感。

sentences.english: Many people can't resist the lure of money.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都抵挡不住金钱的诱惑。

sentences.english: Can you resist erosion of the rain.
sentences.chinese: 你能抵挡得住天雨的侵蚀吗。
谁能抵挡这条鱼的魅力？

sentences.english: One security guard used it as a shield against the torrent of people that streamed into the store.
sentences.chinese: 有个保安把该门板用作盾牌，抵挡涌入商场的人潮。

sentences.english: The assistant's sister insists on (persists in) resisting the group consisting of tree mem.
sentences.chinese: 助手的妹妹坚决主张抵挡那个由三人组成的小组。

sentences.english: How can we resist the Devil?
sentences.chinese: 我们要怎样抵挡魔鬼呢？

sentences.english: I stood there awhile and tried not to let the cold get to me.
sentences.chinese: 我在那站了一会，试图抵挡严寒的侵袭。

sentences.english: How was the casing of the barricade going to behave under the cannon-balls?
sentences.chinese: 街垒的墙将怎样抵挡炮弹呢？

sentences.english: Hair insulates animals against the sun by day as well as against the cold by night.
sentences.chinese: 毛发使得动物可以在白天抵挡阳光，在夜晚抵挡严寒。

sentences.english: Hair insulates animals against the sun by day as well as against the cold by night.
sentences.chinese: 毛发使得动物可以在白天抵挡阳光，在夜晚抵挡严寒。

sentences.english: He can't resist the flimsiness of the life.
sentences.chinese: 他无法抵挡生命的脆弱。

sentences.english: German family firms are outdoing their Chinese rivals.
sentences.chinese: 德国家族型企业抵挡中国企业的竞争压力。

sentences.english: Red turns up the hit and makes you irresistible.
sentences.chinese: 红色让人眼前一亮，让你不可抵挡。

definition: to resist/to ward off/to hold one's own/to receive guests
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to control/to curb/to restrict/to impede/to pin down (enemy troops)
to handle/to deal with/to cope/to get by with
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
